src.datastruct.dtm module#

A module for manipulating a digital elevation model.

class src.datastruct.dtm.Dtm(*args, **kwargs)[source]#

Bases: WorldImageDtm

Represents a digital elevation model.

Parameters:

  • path_dtm (str) – Path to the dtm file. If None Dtm.get() always returns 0.

  • order (int) – The method of interpolation to perform. 0 : nearest, 1 : slinear, 3 : cubic, 5 : quintic.

  • cval (int) – Value to fill past edges of dtm. If None raise an error for any point outside the dtm.

  • keep_in_memory (bool) – Store all data in memory.

Note

All gdal formats are supported. The file must contain georeferencing information.

get_z_world(coor_2d: ndarray) → ndarray[source]#

Extract value in the Dtm.

Parameters:

coor_2d (np.array) – World coordinate 2D [X, Y].

Returns:

z value.

Return type:

np.array

set_cval(cval: int) → None[source]#

Value to fill past edges of dtm or nodata. If None raise an error for any point outside the dtm or Nodata.

Args

cval (int): Value to fill past edges of dtm or nodata.

set_dtm(path_dtm: str, type_dtm: str) → None[source]#

Set the dtm path for reading dtm.

Parameters:

  • path_dtm (str) – Path to the dtm file.

  • type (str) – Type of dtm “a” altitude, “h” height.

set_keep_memory(keep_memory: bool) → None[source]#

Store all image in memory.

Parameters:

keep_in_memory (bool) – Store all image in memory.

set_order(order: int) → None[source]#

The method of interpolation to perform. 0:nearest 1:bilinear 3:cubic 5:quintic.

Parameters:

order (int) – The method of interpolation to perform.

src.datastruct.gcp module#

Ground Control Point (GCP) class.

class src.datastruct.gcp.GCP(name_gcp: str, code: int, coor: ndarray)[source]#

Bases: object

Ground Control Point class.

Parameters:

  • name_gcp (str) – Name of the gcp.

  • code (int) – IGN code to differentiate between support points (1, 2, 3) and control points (11, 12, 13) 1 means precision in Z, 2 in X and Y and 3 in X, Y, Z.

  • coor (numpy.array) – Array of ground coordinate [X, Y, Z].

code: int#
coor: ndarray#
name_gcp: str#

src.datastruct.shot module#

Acquisition data class module.

class src.datastruct.shot.Shot(name_shot: str, pos_shot: ndarray, ori_shot: ndarray, name_cam: str, unit_angle: str, linear_alteration: bool)[source]#

Bases: object

Shot class definition.

Parameters:

  • name_shot (str) – Name of the shot.

  • pos_shot (numpy.array) – Array of coordinate position [X, Y, Z].

  • ori_shot (numpy.array) – Array of orientation of the shot [Omega, Phi, Kappa] in degree.

  • name_cam (str) – Name of the camera.

  • unit_angle (str) – Unit of angle ‘degrees’, ‘radian’.

  • linear_alteration (bool) – True if z shot is correct of linear alteration.

classmethod from_param_euclidean(name_shot: str, pos_eucli: ndarray, mat_ori_eucli: ndarray, name_cam: str, unit_angle: str, linear_alteration: bool, approx: bool) → None[source]#

Construction of a shot object using the Euclidean position.

Parameters:

  • name_shot (str) – Name of the shot.

  • pos_eucli (np.array) – Euclidean position of the shot.

  • mat_ori_eucli (np.array) – Euclidean rotation matrix of the shot.

  • name_cam (str) – Name of the camera.

  • unit_angle (str) – Unit of angle ‘degrees’, ‘radian’.

  • linear_alteration (bool) – True if z shot is correct of linear alteration.

  • approx (bool) – True if you want to use approx euclidean system.

Returns:

The shot.

Return type:

Shot

get_z_add_scale_factor() → float[source]#

Return Z after adding the scale factor. The Z of the object is NOT modified.

Returns:

z with linear alteration.

Return type:

float

get_z_remove_scale_factor() → float[source]#

Return Z after removing the scale factor. The Z of the object is NOT modified.

Returns:

z without linear alteration.

Return type:

float

src.datastruct.workdata module#

Workdata data class module.

class src.datastruct.workdata.Workdata(name: str)[source]#

Bases: object

Workdata class.

add_camera(name_camera: str, ppax: float, ppay: float, focal: float, width: float, height: float) → None[source]#

Add data camera in the Worksite.

Parameters:

  • name_camera (str) – Name of the camera.

  • ppax (float) – Center of distortion in x.

  • ppay (float) – Center of distortion in y.

  • focal (float) – Focal of the camera.

  • width (float) – Width of the image camera.

  • height (float) – Height of the image camera.

add_co_point(name_point: str, name_shot: str, x: float, y: float) → None[source]#

Add linking point between acquisition in two part. One in self.co_points a dict with name_point the key and list of acquisition the result. And One in self.shot[name_shot].co_points a dict whit name_point the key and list of coordinate x (column) y (line) the result in list.

Agrs:

name_point (str): Name of the connecting point. name_shot (str): Name of the acquisition. x (float): Pixel position of the point in column. y (float): Pixel position of the point in line.

add_gcp(name_gcp: str, code_gcp: int, coor_gcp: ndarray) → None[source]#

Add GCP in the Worksite.

Parameters:

  • name_gcp (str) – Name of the gcp.

  • code_gcp (int) – IGN code to differentiate between support points (1, 2, 3) and control points (11, 12, 13). 1 means precision in Z, 2 in X and Y and 3 in X, Y, Z.

  • coor_gcp (numpy.array) – Array of ground coordinate [X, Y, Z].

add_ground_img_pt(name_point: str, name_shot: str, x: float, y: float) → None[source]#

Add linking point between acquisition in two part. One in self.ground_img_pts a dict with name_point the key and list of acquisition the result. And One in self.shot[name_shot].ground_img_pts a dict whit name_point the key and list of coordinate x (column) y (line) the result in list.

Agrs:

name_point (str): Name of the connecting point. name_shot (str): Name of the acquisition. x (float): Pixel position of the point in column. y (float): Pixel position of the point in line.

add_shot(name_shot: str, pos_shot: ndarray, ori_shot: ndarray, name_cam: str, unit_angle: str, linear_alteration: bool) → None[source]#

Add Shot to the attribut Shots.

Parameters:

  • name_shot (str) – Name of the shot.

  • pos_shot (np.array) – Array of coordinate position [X, Y, Z].

  • ori_shot (np.array) – Array of orientation of the shot [Omega, Phi, Kappa].

  • name_cam (str) – Name of the camera.

  • unit_angle (str) – Unit of angle ‘degrees’, ‘radian’.

  • linear_alteration (bool) – True if z shot is correct of linear alteration.

known_projection(epsg: int = 2154, path_geotiff: Path | None = None) → None[source]#

Setup a projection system to the worksite.

Parameters:

  • epsg (int) – Code epsg of the porjection ex: “EPSG:2154”.

  • path_geotiff (Path) – List of GeoTIFF which represents the ellipsoid in grid form.

set_approx_eucli_proj(approx: bool) → None[source]#

Setup approxeucli in worksite

Parameters:

apprx (bool) – True if there are not projengine

set_dtm(path_dtm: str, type_dtm: str) → None[source]#

set class DtM to the worksite.

Parameters:

  • path_dtm (str) – Path to the dtm.

  • type (str) – Type of the dtm “altitude” or “height”.

set_proj(epsg: int, file_epsg: str | None = None, path_geotiff: str | None = None) → None[source]#

Setup a projection system to the worksite.

Parameters:

  • epsg (int) – Code epsg of the porjection ex: 2154.

  • file_epsg (str) – Path to the json which list projection.

  • path_geotiff (str) – List of GeoTIFF which represents the ellipsoid in grid form.
